description: Conversion of two bedroom flat into two separate one bedroom flats and side roof extension.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) 130415-EX01 - Existing Site Plan; 130415-EX02 - Existing Block Plan; 130415-EX03 - Existing Roof Plan; 130415-EX04 - Existing Ground Floor Plan; 130415-EX05 - Existing First Floor Plan; 130415-EX06 - Existing Front Elevation; 130415-EX07 - Existing Rear Elevation; 130415-EX08 - Existing Side Elevation; 130415-PR01 - Proposed roof plan; 130415-PR02 - Proposed ground floor plan; 130415-PR03 - Proposed first floor plan; 130415-PR05 - Proposed front elevation; "side elevation" (proposed); "rear elevation" (proposed); "loft plan" (proposed). unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted. All windows within the dormer along the side elevation shall be obscure glazed and retained in this form for the lifetime of the development.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1 & 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Plan Document; and policy 3.5 of the London Plan (2011) | Cycle parking for two bicycles, in accordance with the Council's adopted standards, shall be provided prior to first occupation of units 2 & 3 hereby approved and shall be retained permanently thereafter.  Reason: To provide adequate cycle facilities and to promote sustainable patterns of transport, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.6 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 & 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2011) and SPD 4: Residential Extensions. | Refuse and recycling storage enclosures, in accordance with the Council's adopted standards, shall be provided prior to first occupation of the residential units hereby approved and retained permanently, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To protect the living conditions of residents of the building and nearby occupiers in accordance with policies 2.10 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' 2004 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 'Refuse and Recycling'.
